subject: RE: [junit] @BeforeClass throws NullPointerException
msgSnippet: @BeforeClass methods must be static. The validation code should have checked that and given you a helpful error message. That will teach us not to duplicate
messageBody:
@BeforeClass methods must be static. The validation code should have checked
that and given you a helpful error message. That will teach us not to
duplicate code (the JUnit 4 runner gives the right error message). I have a
fix ready to check in after review.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
